name: Butter Chicken
ingredients: Chicken, Butter, Tomatoes, Onions, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Cream, Yogurt, Garam Masala, Turmeric, Chili Powder, Coriander Powder, Cumin Powder, Kasuri Methi
instructions: 1. Marinate chicken with yogurt and spices for at least 30 minutes. 2. Blend onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste into a smooth puree. 3. Heat butter in a pan, saute the puree until fragrant. 4. Add marinated chicken and cook until browned. 5. Pour in cream, add Kasuri Methi, and simmer until the sauce thickens. Serve with naan or rice.

name: Chicken Tikka Masala
ingredients: Chicken, Yogurt, Onions, Tomato Puree, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Cream, Garam Masala, Turmeric, Chili Powder, Coriander Powder, Cumin Powder, Kasuri Methi
instructions: 1. Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices for at least 2 hours. 2. Grill or pan-fry the marinated chicken until cooked through. 3. In a pan, sauté onions, ginger-garlic paste, and tomato puree. 4. Add cream, spices, and Kasuri Methi. 5. Simmer until the sauce thickens. 6. Add the cooked chicken and serve with naan or rice.

name: Samosa
ingredients: Flour, Oil, Water, Potatoes, Peas, Cumin Seeds, Coriander Powder, Turmeric Powder, Chili Powder, Oil for deep frying
instructions: 1. Make a dough with flour, oil, and water. 2. Prepare the filling with boiled potatoes, peas, and spices. 3. Roll out small portions of dough and fill with the potato mixture. 4. Shape into triangles and deep fry until golden brown. Serve with chutney.

name: Biryani
ingredients: Basmati Rice, Vegetables or Chicken or Mutton, Yogurt, Onions, Tomatoes, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Biryani Masala, Turmeric, Chili Powder, Saffron, Ghee, Mint Leaves, Coriander Leaves
instructions: 1. Marinate protein (if using) with yogurt and spices. 2. Parboil basmati rice with spices. 3. Layer marinated protein, fried onions, and rice in a large pot. 4. Add saffron-infused milk and ghee. 5. Cook on low heat (dum) until the flavors meld. Garnish with fresh herbs.

name: Palak Paneer
ingredients: Paneer, Spinach, Onions, Tomatoes, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Cream, Cumin Seeds, Coriander Powder, Turmeric Powder, Green Chilies
instructions: 1. Blanch and puree spinach. 2. Sauté onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, and spices. 3. Add the spinach puree and cream. 4. Simmer until the gravy thickens. 5. Add paneer cubes and cook for a few minutes. Serve with roti or naan.

name: Chana Masala
ingredients: Chickpeas, Onions, Tomatoes, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Chana Masala Powder, Turmeric, Chili Powder, Coriander Powder, Green Chilies, Cilantro
instructions: 1. Soak chickpeas overnight and pressure cook until soft. 2. Sauté onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, and spices. 3. Add cooked chickpeas and simmer until flavors blend. 4. Garnish with cilantro and serve with Bhatura or rice.

name: Dal Makhani
ingredients: Whole Urad Dal, Kidney Beans, Butter, Cream, Onions, Tomatoes, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Garam Masala, Turmeric, Chili Powder, Kasuri Methi
instructions: 1. Soak lentils and beans overnight. 2. Pressure cook with butter and cream until very soft. 3. Sauté onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, and spices. 4. Add the cooked dal and beans, simmer for 30 minutes. 5. Garnish with Kasuri Methi and butter. Serve with naan or rice.

name: Aloo Gobi
ingredients: Potatoes, Cauliflower, Onions, Tomatoes, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Turmeric, Chili Powder, Coriander Powder, Cumin Powder, Green Chilies, Cilantro
instructions: 1. Cut potatoes and cauliflower into florets. 2. Sauté cumin seeds, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, and spices. 3. Add potatoes and cauliflower. 4. Cook until tender. Garnish with cilantro. Serve with roti.

name: Baingan Bharta
ingredients: Eggplant, Onions, Tomatoes, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Green Chilies, Cumin Seeds, Coriander Powder, Turmeric Powder, Chili Powder, Cilantro
instructions: 1. Roast eggplant directly on flame or in an oven until charred and cooked. 2. Peel and mash the eggplant. 3. Sauté onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, and spices. 4. Add mashed eggplant and cook. Garnish with cilantro. Serve with roti.

name: Masala Dosa
ingredients: Rice, Urad Dal, Potatoes, Onions, Mustard Seeds, Curry Leaves, Chana Masala, Turmeric Powder, Oil
instructions: 1. Soak rice and lentils separately for 4-5 hours. 2. Grind into a smooth batter and ferment overnight. 3. Prepare potato masala by sauteing onions, mustard seeds, curry leaves with spices and boiled potatoes. 4. Spread dosa batter thinly on a hot griddle. 5. Place potato masala in the center and fold. Serve hot with sambar and chutney.

name: Idli Sambar
ingredients: Rice, Urad Dal, Vegetables, Tamarind Pulp, Sambar Powder, Mustard Seeds, Curry Leaves
instructions: 1. Soak rice and lentils for 4-5 hours, then grind to a smooth batter. Ferment overnight. 2. Steam batter in idli molds for 10-15 minutes. 3. Prepare sambar by cooking vegetables, tamarind pulp, and spices together. 4. Serve hot idlis with sambar and chutney.

name: Vada Pav
ingredients: Potatoes, Gram Flour, Breadcrumbs, Turmeric Powder, Chili Powder, Green Chilies, Pav, Chutneys
instructions: 1. Make a batter with gram flour, spices, and water. 2. Mash boiled potatoes with green chilies and spices. 3. Dip potato mixture in batter and deep fry until golden. 4. Slit pav (buns) and spread chutney. 5. Place the fried vada inside the bun. Serve hot.

name: Pav Bhaji
ingredients: Pav, Potatoes, Cauliflower, Green Peas, Tomatoes, Onions, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Pav Bhaji Masala, Butter, Coriander Leaves
instructions: 1. Mash boiled potatoes, cauliflower, and peas. 2. Sauté onions, ginger-garlic paste, and spices. 3. Add mashed vegetables and Pav Bhaji masala. 4. Cook until fragrant. Serve hot with buttered and toasted pav.

name: Chole Bhature
ingredients: Chickpeas, Onions, Tomatoes, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Chole Masala, Turmeric, Chili Powder, Flour, Yogurt, Oil
instructions: 1. Soak chickpeas overnight and pressure cook with spices. 2. Make a dough for Bhatura and let it rise. 3. Prepare the Chole by cooking onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste with cooked chickpeas and spices. 4. Deep fry Bhatura until fluffy. Serve hot with chole.

name: Gulab Jamun
ingredients: Milk Powder, All-Purpose Flour, Sugar, Water, Rose Water, Cardamom Powder, Ghee
instructions: 1. Make a dough with milk powder, flour, and ghee. 2. Shape into small balls. 3. Fry in ghee until golden brown. 4. Make sugar syrup with sugar, water, rose water, and cardamom. 5. Soak fried balls in sugar syrup until they puff up and absorb the syrup.

name: Jalebi
ingredients: All-Purpose Flour, Yogurt, Sugar, Water, Saffron Strands, Cardamom Pods, Oil for deep frying
instructions: 1. Make a batter with flour, yogurt, and water. Let it ferment for a few hours. 2. Make sugar syrup with sugar, water, saffron strands, and cardamom. 3. Pour batter into a piping bag or ziplock bag with a small hole. 4. Make spiral shapes of batter in hot oil and fry until crispy. 5. Dip hot jalebis in sugar syrup. Serve hot or cold.

name: Rasgulla
ingredients: Chenna, Sugar, Water, Rose Water, Cardamom Powder
instructions: 1. Knead chenna until smooth. 2. Make small balls from the chenna. 3. Prepare sugar syrup with sugar, water, rose water, and cardamom. 4. Boil the chenna balls in the sugar syrup until they double in size. Serve chilled.

name: Kheer
ingredients: Rice, Milk, Sugar, Nuts, Cardamom Powder, Saffron Strands
instructions: 1. Rinse and soak rice for 15 minutes. 2. Boil milk in a pot. 3. Add rice, sugar, cardamom, and saffron to the milk. 4. Cook on low heat, stirring frequently, until the rice is cooked and the kheer thickens. 5. Garnish with chopped nuts. Serve hot or cold.

name: Lassi
ingredients: Yogurt, Water, Sugar or Salt, Ice Cubes, Mango, Rose Water, Cardamom
instructions: 1. Blend yogurt, water, sugar/salt, and ice until smooth and frothy. 2. For variations, add mango pulp, rose water, or cardamom powder while blending. Serve chilled.

name: Masala Chai
ingredients: Water, Milk, Sugar, Tea Leaves, Ginger, Cardamom Pods, Cinnamon Stick, Cloves, Black Peppercorns
instructions: 1. Crush ginger, cardamom, cinnamon, cloves, and peppercorns lightly. 2. Boil water, add crushed spices and tea leaves. 3. Add milk and sugar, boil for a few minutes until you get desired color and strength. 4. Strain and serve hot.

name: Aloo Paratha
ingredients: Wheat Flour, Boiled Potatoes, Cumin Seeds, Coriander Powder, Turmeric Powder, Garam Masala, Ghee or Oil
instructions: 1. Make a dough with wheat flour and water. 2. Mash boiled potatoes and mix with spices. 3. Roll out small portions of dough, fill with potato mixture, and flatten. 4. Cook on a hot griddle with ghee/oil until golden brown and crispy.

name: Gobi Paratha
ingredients: Wheat Flour, Grated Cauliflower, Cumin Seeds, Coriander Powder, Turmeric Powder, Green Chilies, Ghee or Oil
instructions: 1. Make a dough with wheat flour and water. 2. Grate cauliflower and squeeze out excess water. 3. Mix grated cauliflower with spices and herbs. 4. Stuff the dough with this mixture, roll out, and cook on a hot griddle with ghee/oil until golden brown.

name: Paneer Paratha
ingredients: Wheat Flour, Grated Paneer, Cumin Seeds, Coriander Powder, Turmeric Powder, Chopped Onions, Green Chilies, Ghee or Oil
instructions: 1. Make a dough with wheat flour and water. 2. Mix grated paneer with spices, onions, and green chilies. 3. Fill the dough with this mixture, roll out, and cook on a hot griddle with ghee/oil until golden brown and crispy.

name: Poori Chana Masala
ingredients: Wheat Flour, Oil, Water, Chickpeas, Onions, Tomatoes, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Cumin Seeds, Coriander Powder, Turmeric Powder, Garam Masala, Oil
instructions: 1. Make a dough for poori (deep-fried puffed bread). 2. Prepare chana masala (spicy chickpea curry). 3. Fry pooris in hot oil until puffed and golden. 4. Serve hot pooris with chana masala.

name: Rajma Chawal
ingredients: Kidney Beans, Onions, Tomatoes, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Cumin Seeds, Coriander Powder, Turmeric Powder, Red Chilli Powder, Cream, Rice
instructions: 1. Soak kidney beans overnight. 2. Pressure cook the beans with water and salt until soft. 3. In a pan, sauté onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, and spices. 4. Add cooked beans and simmer until the flavors meld. 5. Add cream and simmer for a few more minutes. 6. Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Kadai Paneer
ingredients: Paneer, Onions, Bell Peppers, Tomatoes, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Green Chilies, Cream, Coriander Seeds, Cumin Seeds, Kasuri Methi, Red Chili Powder
instructions: 1. Cut paneer into cubes and lightly fry or grill them. 2. In a kadai (wok), sauté onions, bell peppers, and ginger-garlic paste. 3. Add chopped tomatoes, green chilies, and ground spices. 4. Simmer until the gravy thickens. 5. Add the paneer cubes and cream, and cook for a few minutes. Serve hot with roti or naan.

name: Malai Kofta
ingredients: Potatoes, Paneer, Cream, Cashew Nuts, Raisins, Garam Masala, Cardamom Powder, Oil for deep frying
instructions: 1. Boil and mash potatoes. 2. Mix mashed potatoes with crumbled paneer, spices, and make small balls. 3. Deep fry the balls until golden brown. 4. Make a creamy gravy with onions, tomatoes, cashew paste, and spices. 5. Add the fried koftas to the gravy and simmer. Serve hot with naan or jeera rice.

name: Navratan Korma
ingredients: Mixed Vegetables, Paneer, Yogurt, Cream, Cashew Nuts, Raisins, Garam Masala, Cardamom Powder, Oil
instructions: 1. Blanch the vegetables. 2. Fry paneer (optional) until lightly golden. 3. Make a creamy gravy with onions, tomatoes, cashew paste, yogurt, and spices. 4. Add the blanched vegetables, fried paneer, and simmer until the flavors blend. 5. Garnish with cream, raisins, and chopped nuts. Serve hot with roti, naan, or jeera rice.

name: Bhindi Masala
ingredients: Okra, Onions, Tomatoes, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Turmeric Powder, Red Chilli Powder, Coriander Powder, Cumin Powder, Oil, Fresh Coriander Leaves
instructions: 1. Wash and pat dry the okra. Cut off the top and tail ends and cut into 1-inch pieces. 2. Heat oil in a pan, add okra and fry until golden and crispy. Keep aside. 3. In the same pan, add cumin seeds, chopped onions, ginger-garlic paste, and sauté. 4. Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and coriander powder. Cook until the oil separates. 5. Add the fried okra, salt and mix well. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Aloo Matar
ingredients: Potatoes, Green Peas, Onions, Tomatoes, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Turmeric Powder, Red Chilli Powder, Coriander Powder, Garam Masala, Oil, Fresh Coriander Leaves
instructions: 1. Peel and cube the potatoes. 2. In a pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds, chopped onions, ginger-garlic paste and sauté. 3. Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and coriander powder. 4. Add potatoes, green peas, and salt. Cook until potatoes are tender. 5. Garnish with garam masala and fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Dal Tadka
ingredients: Toor Dal, Water, Turmeric Powder, Salt, Ghee or Oil, Mustard Seeds, Cumin Seeds, Dried Red Chilies, Curry Leaves, Chopped Onions, Chopped Tomatoes, Green Chilies, Garlic, Red Chilli Powder, Garam Masala, Fresh Coriander Leaves
instructions: 1. Wash and cook toor dal with water, turmeric powder, and salt in a pressure cooker. 2. In a separate pan, heat ghee/oil and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, dried red chilies, and curry leaves. 3. Once they splutter, add chopped onions, chopped tomatoes, green chilies, minced garlic, and red chili powder. 4. Pour the cooked dal into the pan and mix well. 5. Simmer for a few minutes. 6. Garnish with garam masala, fresh coriander leaves, and a dollop of ghee/oil. Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Vegetable Pulao
ingredients: Basmati Rice, Mixed Vegetables, Onions, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Bay Leaf, Cinnamon Stick, Cardamom Pods, Cloves, Green Cardamoms, Cumin Seeds, Coriander Powder, Turmeric Powder, Ghee or Oil, Salt, Fresh Coriander Leaves
instructions: 1. Rinse and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes. 2. Heat ghee/oil in a pot and add whole spices (bay leaf, cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, green cardamoms, and cumin seeds). 3. Add chopped onions, ginger-garlic paste and sauté until fragrant. 4. Add mixed vegetables and sauté for a few minutes. 5. Add soaked rice and sauté for 2 minutes. 6. Pour water and add salt. 7. Cover and cook on low heat until rice is cooked and water is absorbed. 8. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with raita or curry.

name: Upma
ingredients: Semolina, Oil or Ghee, Mustard Seeds, Chana Dal, Urad Dal, Curry Leaves, Green Chilies, Ginger, Onions, Vegetables, Water, Salt, Lemon Juice, Fresh Coriander Leaves
instructions: 1. Heat oil/ghee in a pan and add mustard seeds, chana dal, urad dal, curry leaves. 2. Once they splutter, add chopped green chilies, grated ginger, and onions. 3. Add optional vegetables and saute. 4. Add semolina and roast it for 2-3 minutes. 5. Pour water, add salt and mix well. 6. Cover and cook on low heat until the water is absorbed and upma is cooked. 7. Squeeze lemon juice, garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with chutney or podi.

name: Poha
ingredients: Flattened Rice Flakes, Oil, Mustard Seeds, Cumin Seeds, Curry Leaves, Green Chilies, Onions, Potatoes, Turmeric Powder, Sugar, Salt, Lemon Juice, Fresh Coriander Leaves, Peanuts
instructions: 1. Rinse poha in water and drain. 2. Heat oil and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, chopped green chilies. 3. Add chopped onions, diced potatoes and saute. 4. Add turmeric powder, sugar, salt, and mix well. 5. Add the soaked poha and gently mix everything. 6. Cover and cook for 2-3 minutes. 7. Add lemon juice, garnish with coriander leaves, roasted peanuts. Serve hot with chutney.

name: Chicken 65
ingredients: Chicken, Yogurt, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Red Chilli Powder, Turmeric Powder, Curry Leaves, Lemon Juice, Cornstarch, Rice Flour, Oil for deep frying, Salt, Pepper
instructions: 1. Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, curry leaves, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. 2. Add cornstarch and rice flour to the marinade and mix well. 3. Heat oil for deep frying. 4. Deep fry the marinated chicken pieces until golden brown and crispy. 5. Garnish with curry leaves. Serve hot.

name: Fish Fry
ingredients: Fish Fillets, Turmeric Powder, Red Chili Powder, Lemon Juice, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Rice Flour, Oil for Shallow Frying, Salt, Pepper, Curry Leaves
instructions: 1. Marinate fish fillets with turmeric powder, red chili powder, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, salt, and pepper. 2. Coat the marinated fish with rice flour. 3. Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the fish fillets until golden brown and crispy. 4. Garnish with curry leaves and serve hot.

name: Gobi Manchurian
ingredients: Cauliflower, All-Purpose Flour, Cornstarch, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Soy Sauce, Vinegar, Green Chilies, Spring Onions, Sugar, Salt, Oil for deep frying
instructions: 1. Cut cauliflower into florets and blanch them. 2. Make a batter with all-purpose flour, cornstarch, ginger-garlic paste, salt, and water. 3. Dip cauliflower florets in the batter and deep fry until golden and crispy. 4. In another pan, sauté chopped ginger-garlic, green chilies, and spring onions. 5. Add soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, and salt. 6. Add the fried cauliflower florets and toss to coat. Serve hot.

name: Paneer Chilli
ingredients: Paneer, All-Purpose Flour, Cornstarch, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Soy Sauce, Vinegar, Green Chilies, Capsicum, Onions, Spring Onions, Sugar, Salt, Oil for deep frying
instructions: 1. Cut paneer into cubes and lightly fry them. 2. Make a batter with all-purpose flour, cornstarch, ginger-garlic paste, salt, and water. 3. Dip paneer cubes in the batter and deep fry until golden and crispy. 4. In another pan, sauté chopped onions, capsicum, ginger-garlic, and green chilies. 5. Add soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, and salt. 6. Add the fried paneer cubes and toss to coat. Serve hot with spring onions.

name: Chicken Biryani Hyderabadi
ingredients: Chicken, Basmati Rice, Yogurt, Onions, Tomatoes, Green Chilies, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Mint Leaves, Coriander Leaves, Cinnamon, Cloves, Cardamom, Bay Leaf, Star Anise, Black Peppercorns, Turmeric Powder, Red Chilli Powder, Ghee or Oil, Saffron, Milk
instructions: 1. Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, mint leaves, coriander leaves, and spices. 2. Partially cook basmati rice with salt and whole spices. 3. Layer marinated chicken and parboiled rice in a large pot, adding fried onions, saffron-infused milk, and ghee/oil. 4. Cook on low heat (dum) until rice is fully cooked and flavors are infused.

name: Mutton Biryani Lucknowi
ingredients: Mutton, Basmati Rice, Yogurt, Onions, Tomatoes, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Saffron, Milk, Kewra Water, Rose Water, Green Cardamoms, Black Cardamoms, Cloves, Cinnamon, Bay Leaf, Mace, Nutmeg, Black Peppercorns, Red Chili Powder, Ghee or Oil, Fresh Mint Leaves, Fresh Coriander Leaves, Fried Onions
instructions: 1. Marinate mutton with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and spices. 2. Partially cook basmati rice with salt and whole spices. 3. Layer marinated mutton and parboiled rice in a large pot, adding saffron-infused milk, kewra water, rose water, ghee/oil, and fried onions. 4. Cook on low heat (dum) until rice is fully cooked, mutton is tender, and flavors are infused. Garnish with fresh mint and coriander leaves.

name: Veg Biryani
ingredients: Basmati Rice, Mixed Vegetables, Yogurt, Onions, Tomatoes, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Mint Leaves, Coriander Leaves, Biryani Masala, Turmeric Powder, Red Chilli Powder, Ghee or Oil, Saffron, Milk
instructions: 1. Parboil basmati rice with salt and whole spices. 2. Sauté vegetables separately with ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, and red chili powder. 3. Layer sautéed vegetables, parboiled rice, fried onions, saffron-infused milk, ghee/oil, and fresh herbs in a large pot. 4. Cook on low heat (dum) until rice is fully cooked and flavors are infused.

name: Mutton Rogan Josh
ingredients: Mutton, Yogurt, Onions, Oil or Ghee, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Kashmiri Red Chili Powder, Cloves, Green Cardamoms, Black Cardamoms, Bay Leaf, Cinnamon Stick, Water, Salt, Dried Ginger Powder, Fennel Powder, Asafoetida, Dried Mint Leaves, Fresh Coriander Leaves
instructions: 1. Marinate mutton with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, Kashmiri red chili powder, and salt. 2. Heat oil/ghee in a pot. Add whole spices (cloves, cardamom, bay leaf, cinnamon) and saute. 3. Add chopped onions and cook until golden brown. 4. Add the marinated mutton and cook until browned. 5. Add water, cover, and cook until mutton is tender. 6. Add dried ginger powder, fennel powder, asafoetida, and dried mint leaves. Simmer for a few minutes. 7. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Rogan Josh (Mushroom/Paneer)
ingredients: Mushrooms or Paneer, Yogurt, Onions, Oil or Ghee, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Kashmiri Red Chili Powder, Cloves, Green Cardamoms, Black Cardamoms, Bay Leaf, Cinnamon Stick, Water, Salt, Dried Ginger Powder, Fennel Powder, Asafoetida, Dried Mint Leaves, Fresh Coriander Leaves
instructions: 1. If using paneer, cut into cubes and lightly fry. If using mushrooms, clean and slice them. 2. Heat oil/ghee in a pot. Add whole spices (cloves, cardamom, bay leaf, cinnamon) and saute. 3. Add chopped onions and cook until golden brown. 4. Add the mushrooms/paneer and cook for a few minutes. 5. Add water, cover, and cook until mushrooms/paneer are tender. 6. Add dried ginger powder, fennel powder, asafoetida, and dried mint leaves. Simmer for a few minutes. 7. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Malai Methi Matar
ingredients: Fresh Fenugreek Leaves, Green Peas, Onions, Tomatoes, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Cream, Milk, Cashew Nuts, Green Cardamom, Cloves, Cinnamon, Ghee or Oil, Salt, Sugar, Fresh Coriander Leaves
instructions: 1. Blanch the fenugreek leaves (methi) and puree them. 2. Grind cashew nuts into a smooth paste. 3. Heat ghee/oil in a pan, add cloves, green cardamom, and cinnamon. 4. Add chopped onions, ginger-garlic paste and saute. 5. Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, and cook until oil separates. 6. Add the blanched green peas. 7. Add the fenugreek leaves puree, cashew paste, cream, and milk. 8. Simmer until the gravy thickens. 9. Add salt, sugar, and mix well. 10. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with roti, naan, or rice.

name: Saag Paneer
ingredients: Spinach, Mustard Greens, Bathua Leaves, Paneer, Onions, Tomatoes, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Green Chilies, Cream, Ghee or Oil, Cumin Seeds, Coriander Powder, Turmeric Powder, Red Chili Powder, Garam Masala, Salt, Fresh Coriander Leaves
instructions: 1. Blanch spinach, mustard greens, and bathua leaves (if using) and puree them. 2. Cut paneer into cubes and lightly fry or grill. 3. Heat ghee/oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. 4. Add chopped onions, ginger-garlic paste, chopped green chilies and sauté. 5. Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and coriander powder. 6. Add the green puree, cream, and salt. 7. Simmer until the gravy thickens. 8. Add the paneer cubes and mix gently. Garnish with garam masala, fresh coriander leaves, and a dollop of cream. Serve hot with roti, naan, or rice.

name: Kadhi Pakora
ingredients: Gram Flour, Yogurt, Turmeric Powder, Red Chilli Powder, Oil or Ghee, Curry Leaves, Fenugreek Seeds, Mustard Seeds, Asafoetida, Coriander Powder, Cumin Powder, Salt, Sugar, Water, Gram Flour, Onions, Green Chilies, Coriander Leaves, Turmeric Powder, Red Chilli Powder, Salt, Oil for deep frying
instructions: 1. Make pakoras by mixing gram flour, chopped onions, green chilies, coriander leaves, spices, and water. Deep fry the pakoras until golden brown. 2. For the kadhi, whisk together gram flour, yogurt, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and water until smooth. 3. Heat oil/ghee in a pan, add curry leaves, fenugreek seeds, mustard seeds, and asafoetida. 4. Add the yogurt-gram flour mixture and cook, stirring continuously, until it comes to a boil and thickens. 5. Add the fried pakoras to the kadhi. 6. Season with salt, sugar, and simmer for a few minutes. 7. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Aloo Tikki
ingredients: Boiled Potatoes, Bread Crumbs, Cumin Powder, Coriander Powder, Red Chili Powder, Garam Masala, Green Chilies, Coriander Leaves, Salt, Oil for shallow frying
instructions: 1. Mash boiled potatoes. 2. Mix mashed potatoes with bread crumbs, spices, chopped green chilies, coriander leaves, and salt. 3. Shape the mixture into round patties (tikkis). 4. Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the tikkis until golden brown and crispy. 5. Serve hot with chutney or as a chaat item.

name: Dahi Bhalla
ingredients: Urad Dal, Moong Dal, Yogurt, Tamarind Chutney, Green Chutney, Roasted Cumin Powder, Red Chili Powder, Chaat Masala, Salt, Chopped Coriander Leaves, Sev
instructions: 1. Soak urad dal and moong dal for 4-5 hours. 2. Grind the lentils into a smooth batter. 3. Heat oil and deep fry small portions of the batter until golden brown and crispy (bhallas). 4. Soak the fried bhallas in water for 10-15 minutes, then gently squeeze out the water. 5. Whisk yogurt until smooth. 6. Place the bhallas in a serving dish. Top with whisked yogurt, tamarind chutney, green chutney, roasted cumin powder, red chili powder, chaat masala, salt, chopped coriander leaves, and sev. Serve chilled.

name: Pani Puri
ingredients: Semolina, Flour, Oil, Water, Boiled Potatoes, Boiled Chickpeas, Chopped Onions, Tamarind Chutney, Mint-Coriander Chutney, Pani Puri Masala, Black Salt, Chaat Masala
instructions: 1. Make a dough with semolina, flour, oil, and water. 2. Roll out small puris and deep-fry them until puffed and crispy. 3. Prepare the filling with boiled potatoes, chickpeas, onions, and spices. 4. Make spiced water (pani) with tamarind chutney, mint chutney, and spices. 5. Crack open a puri, fill it with the potato mixture and spiced water. Serve immediately.

name: Dahi Puri
ingredients: Puris, Boiled Potatoes, Boiled Chickpeas, Chopped Onions, Fine Sev, Sweet Tamarind Chutney, Spicy Green Chutney, Yogurt, Chaat Masala, Red Chilli Powder, Roasted Cumin Powder, Black Salt, Chopped Coriander Leaves
instructions: 1. Prepare the puri shells. You can use store-bought or make them at home. 2. Prepare the fillings: mashed boiled potatoes, boiled chickpeas, and finely chopped onions. 3. In a bowl, whisk the yogurt until smooth and creamy. 4. Assemble the dahi puris: Make a small hole in each puri. 5. Fill the puris with the potato-chickpea mixture. 6. Top with a generous dollop of whisked yogurt. 7. Drizzle sweet tamarind chutney and spicy green chutney over the yogurt. 8. Sprinkle sev, chaat masala, red chili powder, roasted cumin powder, black salt, and chopped coriander leaves on top. Serve immediately.

name: Aloo Chaat
ingredients: Potatoes, Spices, Chutneys, Yogurt
instructions: 1. Boil and dice potatoes. 2. Mix with spices and chutneys. 3. Top with yogurt and sev.

name: Papdi Chaat
ingredients: Papdi, Potatoes, Chickpeas, Chutneys, Yogurt, Spices
instructions: 1. Arrange papdi on a plate. 2. Top with potatoes, chickpeas, chutneys, and yogurt. 3. Sprinkle with spices and sev.

name: Samosa Chaat
ingredients: Samosas, Chutneys, Yogurt, Spices, Sev
instructions: 1. Crumble samosas. 2. Top with chutneys, yogurt, and spices. 3. Garnish with sev and onions.
